page.title: 12Dean Farm
page.content: {Dean Farm}is the oldest farm in the area , using most modern{milking process. Farmhouse ,4 barns including old granary are{Grade 2 listed {buildings}having no repairs, renovations without permission.Centre section originally{'hole'house,500 yrs {old,}rooms added each side, newest addition is 200 yrs old. Dean Farm covers 200 acres, has 200 Friesian milking cows,40 calves ,2 bulls:a Hereford called William, an Angus called Sidney.Artificial insemination is used. The milkng parlour takes 14 cows,a computor records milk production,fodder requirements,all information stored in word processor. Cows are milked twice daily,milk is stored in refrigerated bulk tanks & collected by Milk Marketing tanker- taken to Guildford.
